Description.val: Family of Tactical Trailers provides for the procurement and support of new trailers in the light, medium, and heavy fleet in support of the Marine Corps tactical vehicle mobility capability. This program includes multiple initiatives such as  the M1102-H (Cargo) & M1102-MCC (Marine Corps Chassis) Light Tactical Trailers (LTT), the M1076 PLS (Palletized Load System) Trailer, the MK1077 Flatrack for the PLS Trailer, MTVR Trailer, and the Flatrack Refueler Capability (FRC).

Justification.val:
FY 2014 Base Appropriation: $12.845M 
Funds in the amount of $12.845M supported the MK1077 Palletized Load System (PLS) Flatrack, Flatrack Refueler Capability (FRC), and Light Tactical Trailer program acquisition plans. 

Flatrack Refueler Capability (FRC) - Funds procured additional quantities of the self-contained refueling system and provide the MAGTF the capability to deliver fuel to Forward Arming and Refueling Points (FARPS). 

MK1077 PLS Flatrack - Funds procured flatracks to replace combat losses.

Light Tactical Trailer - Funds procured logistical end items and requisitions in support of the M1102-H and M1102-MCC LTT trailers.

FY 2015 Base Appropriation: $10.179M 
Funds in the amount of $10.179M will be used in support of the MTVR Trailer and MK1077 PLS Flatrack program acquisition plans.     

MTVR Trailer funds will complete the procurement of Full Rate production. The MTVR Modular Trailer will transport weapon systems, ammunition, break bulk cargo, engineer equipment, communications equipment, dimensionally standard shelters and containers and commercial cargo containers. 

FY 2016 Base Appropriation Request: $3.157M 
Funds in the amount of $3.157M will be used in support of the active and reserve Heavy Trailer Fleet program acquisition plans.      

Medium Tactical Trailer funds will support procurement and installation of modifications to the MTVR Trailer for continued support to the Operational Forces by providing the capability to transport required cargo within the mission profile of MTVR.

The decrease ($7.022M) in funding from FY 2015 to FY 2016 is a result of the MTVR Trailer completing full rate production phase and transitioning to sustainment.

Name.@footnote: *FY14 Unit cost difference between Active and Reserve FRC procurements is due to the buys being executed on two different contract pricing years (Jan14 & Jul14).
